alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Roane; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Calhoun, northeastern Kanawha, southern Wirt, Roane, west central Clay and southeastern Jackson Counties through 815 PM EDT... At 746 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Ripley to 7 miles southeast of Kenna to near Charleston. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Ripley, Spencer, Elizabeth, Sissonville, Clendenin, Pinch, Glen, Coal Fork, Elkview, Arnoldsburg, Kenna, Amma, Reedy, Statts Mills, Cherry, Procious, Kentuck, Left Hand and Lucille. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 34. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 100, between mile markers 102 and 105, and between mile markers 123 and 139. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 92 and 95. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Calhoun; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Roane; Wirt
